Although it works in some cases, SSPR can't be guaranteed to work consistently when staged rollout is enabled.\n \n Password writeback provides the following features:\n " }, { "sha": "febccbb48b3ca93e2993f57b2d2147c145dc9f71", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-staged-rollout.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 2, "deletions": 2, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/666ddb80c31dc30efb8ef1b3a527ce9085953e8d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-staged-rollout.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/666ddb80c31dc30efb8ef1b3a527ce9085953e8d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-staged-rollout.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-staged-rollout.md?ref=666ddb80c31dc30efb8ef1b3a527ce9085953e8d", "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: omondiatieno\n manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 07/21/2025\n+ms.date: 10/16/2025\n ms.subservice: hybrid-connect\n ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n@@ -90,7 +90,7 @@ The following scenarios aren't supported for Staged Rollout:\n \n - Legacy authentication such as POP3 and SMTP aren't supported.\n \n-- Self-service password reset with writeback to an on-premises domain isn't supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group. \n+- Self-service password reset (SSPR) with writeback to an on-premises domain isn't supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group. Although it works in some cases, SSPR can't be guaranteed to work consistently when staged rollout is enabled.\n \n - Certain applications send the \"domain_hint\" query parameter to Microsoft Entra ID during authentication. These flows continue, and users who are enabled for Staged Rollout continue to use federation for authentication.\n " } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
The commits detail several updates to Microsoft Entra documentation.

The installation guide for the Global Secure Access client for Windows has been updated with revised installation commands and a clarification on the restart grace period.

A minor image update has been made to the troubleshooting page for Global Secure Access connectors.

Finally, the documentation concerning Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR) writeback has been clarified regarding its compatibility with staged rollouts, with a note that while it might function in some instances, consistent operation cannot be guaranteed.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates several documentation files. It includes changes to the installation guide for the Global Secure Access Windows client, modifying installation commands and clarifying the restart grace period. Additionally, it updates a troubleshooting guide for Global Secure Access connectors with a new image reference and refines the description of limitations for staged rollout in hybrid identity scenarios, specifically regarding self-service password reset writeback.

ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes:

The documentation for Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR) with writeback has been updated to clarify its incompatibility with staged rollouts in Microsoft Entra ID. While it might work in some instances, it's not consistently supported and cannot be guaranteed. This clarification is reflected in both the SSPR concept document and the how-to guide for staged rollouts. Minor date adjustments have also been made in both files.

author: Justinha
message:
Clarify SSPR writeback support with staged rollout

Updated documentation to clarify that self-service password reset (SSPR) writeback to on-premises domains is not consistently supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group, even if it works in some cases. Also updated document dates.

    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: omondiatieno\n manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 07/21/2025\n+ms.date: 10/16/2025\n ms.subservice: hybrid-connect\n ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n@@ -90,7 +90,7 @@ The following scenarios aren't supported for Staged Rollout:\n \n - Legacy authentication such as POP3 and SMTP aren't supported.\n \n-- Self-service password reset with writeback to an on-premises domain isn't supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group. \n+- Self-service password reset (SSPR) with writeback to an on-premises domain isn't supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group. Although it works in some cases, SSPR can't be guaranteed to work consistently when staged rollout is enabled.\n \n - Certain applications send the \"domain_hint\" query parameter to Microsoft Entra ID during authentication. These flows continue, and users who are enabled for Staged Rollout continue to use federation for authentication.\n "

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit updates two documentation files related to Microsoft Entra ID staged rollout and password writeback. The changes clarify that self-service password reset (SSPR) with writeback to an on-premises domain is not supported when staged rollout is enabled for a security group. While it might work in some instances, its consistent functionality cannot be guaranteed in such configurations. The commit also includes minor date updates in the metadata of these documents.
